title: In vitro analyses of paracrine effects of murine classically activated macrophage on beige adipocyte metabolism
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Preparation and culture of bone-marrow-derived macrophage
Timing: 6–7 days
Euthanize 8–12 weeks old CD-1 mice according to an approved IACUC protocol.
Isolate the femurs and tibias at joint, and remove skin and muscle as clear as possible.
Wash 3 times with PBS, then transfer to a new 10 cm dish with PBS at room temperature (RT: 18°C–24°C).
Cut off the ends of the bones and flush with PBS using a 23-gauge needle. Collect bone marrow in a 50 mL Falcon tube.
Centrifuge at 400 × g for 5 min at RT (18°C–24°C) and aspirate supernatant.
Resuspend pellet in 4 mL of BMDM growth medium.
Overlay 4 mL of bone marrow (per mouse) over 3 mL of Ficoll-Paque PLUS Media in a 15 mL tube.
Critical: As slowly as possible, to form a separate and distinct layer.
Centrifuge for 20 min at 600 × g at RT (18°C–24°C), no brake (deceleration rate is 0). Take ∼45 min.
Critical: Do not centrifuge at cold condition because the density of Ficoll will change.
Collect all the supernatant (both Ficoll and BMDM medium, but not the pellet) into a 50 mL tube.
Add 25 mL pre-warmed PBS and mix well.
Centrifuge for 5 min at 200 × g.
Resuspend the cell pellet in BMDM growth medium and plate into 2 Falcon dishes (15 cm).
Critical: Do not use cell culture dish, which will make it difficult to digest differentiated BMDM.
On day 3, 5 and 6, aspirate medium gently and add fresh BMDM growth medium.
Critical: It is very important to change the medium at day 5 and 6 for the differentiation of BMDM. (Troubleshooting 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.1])
By day 7, cells should be fully differentiated and are ready to be plated.

Wash cells with 5 mL PBS once, and then incubate with 5 mL 5 mM EDTA (in PBS) for 5 min in cell incubator.
Note: Do not use trypsin for digestion, which will activate the macrophage, and the digestion should not be longer than 10 min. (Troubleshooting 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.5])
View cells under microscope to ensure that half of cells are detached.
Add another 5 mL pre-warmed BMDM growth medium to stop the digestion by EDTA and resuspend the cells.
Centrifuge for 5 min at 200 × g.
Resuspend the cell pellet with 5 mL BMDM growth medium.
Count and adjust the final cell density to 4–6 × 10ˆ5/mL.
Plate 1 mL cell suspension per well into a 12-well cell culture plate.
After 8–16 h, the plated mature macrophages are stimulated with PBS or 100 ng/mL lipopolysaccharide (LPS) for 4 h (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]).

Optional: You can also polarize the BMDM to classically activated macrophage or alternatively activated macrophage by 10 ng/mL LPS or 10 ng/ml IL-4 treatment for 24–48 h.
Aspirate medium gently, then wash with pre-warmed PBS twice and add fresh BMDM growth medium.
After 12 h, the conditioned medium is collected for cell treatment or stocked at −80°C.
For extracting RNA of BMDM, add 350 μL TRIzol per well and transfer to 1.5 mL tubes. Then perform qRT–PCR to analyze proinflammatory gene expression in BMDM (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).
Preparation and culture of SVF-derived beige adipocyte
Timing: 9–10 days

Add 5 mL pre-chilled scWAT digestion buffer to a 6 cm dish.
Euthanize 12–16 days old CD-1 mice according to an approved IACUC protocol.
Soak mice with 70% ethanol.
Place mouse ventral side up, and make central incision from the base of the tail extending to the sternum.
Note: Make sure not to penetrate the peritoneal cavity.
Pull ventral skin away from both flanks gently and slowly.
Identify the scWAT depot, then use scissor to trace the edges of the tissue and cut along the way until the entire depot is detached from the skin (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/1742-Fig3.jpg
Figure 3. Illustration of scWAT dissection
Transfer dissected scWAT into pre-chilled scWAT digestion buffer in a 6 cm dish immediately.
Wash scWAT twice with pre-chilled scWAT digestion buffer.
Transfer the tissues to a 1.5 mL tube with 200 μL scWAT digestion buffer supplemented with 600 IU/mL collagenase type I.
Mince the tissues by using sterile surgical scissors. Tissue pieces should be ∼1–2 mm thick.
Transfer tissues and scWAT digestion buffer into a 50 mL sterile conical tube containing 15 mL scWAT digestion buffer supplemented with 600 IU/mL collagenase type I.
Place the tube horizontally and digest tissues at 37°C with shaking at 100 rpm for 40–60 min.
Note: Digestion time depends on disappearance of visible pieces of adipose tissue, but no more than 60 min.
Add 15 mL scWAT digestion buffer to stop the digestion.
Suspend tissues promptly by 10 mL pipette until tissue pieces are no longer visible.
Centrifuge the cells for 5 min at 200 × g.
Completely remove mature adipocyte layer and aspirate supernatant gently.
Optional: The mature adipocytes at the upper layer can be collected for analysis.
Resuspend SVF cell pellet in 5 mL scWAT digestion buffer.
Filter the cells by 75 μm cell strainer.

Rinse the cell strainer with another 5 mL scWAT digestion buffer.
Centrifuge the cells for 5 min at 200 × g.
Aspirate supernatant and resuspend SVF cell pellet with beige adipocyte maintenance medium. (SVF cells from every mouse (two pieces of scWAT) resuspended by 2 mL medium).
Plate 1 mL cell suspension per well into a 12-well flat-bottom plate.
Note: The SVF cells from one mouse can be seeded to 2 wells of 12-well flat-bottom plate.
After 12–24 h, remove the beige adipocyte maintenance medium carefully and wash the cells with pre-warmed PBS for twice.
Change beige adipocyte maintenance medium every 2 days until the cells reach 90% confluent.
When the cells reach 90% confluent (day 0), remove beige adipocyte maintenance medium and add 1 mL beige adipocyte induction medium per well.
Critical: Beige adipocyte induction medium has to be prepared freshly prior to usage.
On day 2, remove beige adipocyte induction medium and add 1 mL beige adipocyte differentiation medium per well.
Critical: Beige adipocyte differentiation medium has to be prepared freshly prior to usage.
On day 4, remove the medium and add 1 mL fresh beige adipocyte differentiation medium per well.
Change beige adipocyte differentiation medium every day until the cells are fully differentiated to beige adipocyte on day 7–8 (Figure 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig4]).

Figure 4. Bright-field images illustrating the differentiated beige adipocyte

BMDM conditioned medium treatment for western blot analysis
Timing: ∼24 h
Remove beige adipocyte differentiation medium of beige adipocyte and add 0.5 mL beige adipocyte maintenance medium per well.
Add 0.5 mL conditioned medium from PBS- or LPS-treated BMDM per well.
Culture at 37°C 5% CO2 for 12 h.
Add vehicle (Veh) or 50 nM norepinephrine to differentiated beige adipocyte directly without changing the medium.

Culture at 37°C 5% CO2 for 8 h.
Remove the medium and wash cells twice with pre-chilled PBS.
Remove as much of the PBS as possible.
Add 300 μL RIPA supplemented with protease inhibitor cocktail per well.
Resuspend the cells and transfer to 1.5 mL tubes.
Lyse the cells for 10 min on ice and then vortex.
Centrifuge for 20 min at 15,000 × g and transfer 200 μL supernatant to 1.5 mL tubes.
Note: Avoid to aspirate or contact the sediment as carefully as possible. (Troubleshooting 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.9]).
Add 1/5 volume of 6 × Loading buffer (E.g. add 40 uL 6 × loading buffer into 200 uL supernatant), and boil for 10 min at 95°C.
Store at -20°C until western blot analysis.
